item.title: Vue Notes
item.description: Virtual DOM A Virtual DOM is a lightweight, in-memory representation of the real DOM. Each Node in the Virtual DOM is represented as a plain JavaScript object with properties describing the element, its attributes, and its children. The Virtual DOM will be updated whenever an application’s state changes. It minimizes real DOM updates by batching changes and applying them through an optimized process. --- title: Virtual DOM --- graph TD B["
